BR_text.BRsummary: Documentation Request: mklml DLL depends on MSVCR120.dll
BR_text.BRdescription:
Hello Intel,
 The mklml DLL depends on MSVCR120.dll which comes from Visual Studio 2013 RunTime (which can be downloaded from <denchmark-link:https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784>https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784</denchmark-link>
  or from <denchmark-link:https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/win-64/vs2013_runtime-12.0.21005-1.tar.bz2>https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/main/win-64/vs2013_runtime-12.0.21005-1.tar.bz2</denchmark-link>
  [] ). Could this information please be documented somewhere? Otherwise users who try to use a library linking to this DLL on a clean slate Windows VM, might feel betrayed 
 <denchmark-code>dumpbin /dependents C:\Users\nwani\Downloads\mklml_win_2019.0.20180710\lib\mklml.dll
 Microsoft (R) COFF/PE Dumper Version 14.00.24215.1
 Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved.
 
 
 Dump of file C:\Users\nwani\Downloads\mklml_win_2019.0.20180710\lib\mklml.dll
 
 File Type: DLL
 
   Image has the following dependencies:
 
     MSVCR120.dll
     KERNEL32.dll
     libiomp5md.dll
 
   Summary
 
        E5000 .data
         1000 .data1
        CF000 .pdata
       702000 .rdata
         E000 .reloc
         1000 .rsrc
      6C91000 .text
         1000 .tls
         1000 _RDATA
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text: This issue has been closed, but I don't see mention of vs2013 runtime at the linked web page: <denchmark-link:https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/intel-math-kernel-library-intel-mkl-2019-system-requirements>https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/intel-math-kernel-library-intel-mkl-2019-system-requirements</denchmark-link>

comments_1.comment_text:
There are multiple ways to build Intel MKL-DNN and each of these will result in different set of runtime dependencies depending on specific components used and their corresponding versions. What you are observing with mklml.dll (an optional component) is just one of the possible scenarios. It seems impractical to list all the possible runtime dependencies.
 I added the list of optional components that can be used in Intel MKL-DNN build along with a warning that these may affect runtime dependencies of the library.

comments_2.comment_text: We looked into this issue further and it turns out that this is a defect: Intel MKL small libraries should not have an explicit dependency on MSVS runtime. The defect is reported to Intel MKL team.

comments_3.comment_text:
This issue is addressed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel/mkl-dnn/releases/download/v0.18/mklml_win_2019.0.3.20190220.zip>the latest version of Intel MKL small libraries</denchmark-link>
 .
